metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4352 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The cache_invalidate function in modules/cache/cache_storage.c in themod_cache module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.4.6, when a caching forwardproxy is enabled, allows remote HTTP servers to cause a denial of service(NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via vectors that trigger amissing hostname value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4352` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4').
apache2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4').
